perturbation.original_text: 7.2 Subject to Article 7.3, for a period of five (5) years after the termination of the related RESEARCH PROJECT, the receiving Party shall not use, except (a) for the benefit of the Parties' collaboration or (b) such use as is expressly allowed by this Agreement and/or disclose any Confidential Information to any third party (i) without the prior written consent of the disclosing Party if the Confidential Information was received from the other Party, or (ii) the prior written consent of both Parties if the Confidential Information was generated during a RESEARCH PROJECT, provided however that CERES shall have no restrictions regarding CERES INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY or regarding any information of material resulting from RESEARCH PROJECT activities in which IGER does not participate. Confidential Information shall only be made accessible to each Party's employees or students on a need-to-know basis and not to any third party, subject to Articles 7.3 and 7.4. Manuscripts and papers published in scientific journals and presentations made at public meetings that include Confidential Information are exempt from the confidentiality obligations of this Article, provided the Parties followed the procedure set forth in Article 8.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.2 Subject to Article 7.3, the receiving Party shall not use, except (a) for the benefit of the Parties' collaboration or (b) such use as is expressly allowed by this Agreement and/or disclose any Confidential Information to any third party (i) without the prior written consent of the disclosing Party if the Confidential Information was received from the other Party, or (ii) the prior written consent of both Parties if the Confidential Information was generated during a RESEARCH PROJECT, provided however that CERES shall have no restrictions regarding CERES INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY or regarding any information of material resulting from RESEARCH PROJECT activities in which IGER does not participate. Confidential Information shall only be made accessible to each Party's employees or students on a need-to-know basis and not to any third party, subject to Articles 7.3 and 7.4. Manuscripts and papers published in scientific journals and presentations made at public meetings that include Confidential Information are exempt from the confidentiality obligations of this Article.
perturbation.explanation: The omission of the confidentiality duration creates a legal loophole. UK and US laws require reasonable time limits on confidentiality obligations. By removing the 5-year limitation, the contract could be interpreted as imposing perpetual confidentiality, which is against established contract law principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common Law Principles on Contract Reasonableness, UK Contract Law, US Contract Law

perturbation.original_text: 8.2 The non-disclosing Party shall have the thirty (30) day notice period to object, in writing, to such proposed Disclosure because it contains (a) potentially patentable subject matter that needs protection or (b) BACKGROUND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY or JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY or INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY of the non-disclosing Party or OTHER RESEARCH RESULTS which need to be kept confidential for compelling business reasons in the non-disclosing Party's reasonable judgment. In the event that the non-disclosing Party makes such objection, the disclosing Party will (x) if applicable, elect to cooperate with the non-disclosing Party to obtain proper protection in accordance with the provisions of Article 4 herein or (y) remove the objectionable subject matter from the Disclosure. No delay caused by the non-disclosing Party under this Article shall extend beyond three (3) months, wherein upon such delay, the disclosing Party shall be permitted to proceed without being in breach of this Article.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.2 The non-disclosing Party may object, in writing, to such proposed Disclosure because it contains (a) potentially patentable subject matter or (b) BACKGROUND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY or JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY or INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY of the non-disclosing Party or OTHER RESEARCH RESULTS. In the event that the non-disclosing Party makes such objection, the disclosing Party may remove the objectionable subject matter from the Disclosure.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the timeline by which the non-disclosing party can object (30 days) and the maximum delay (3 months) creates the potential for indefinite delays on publications. This could violate academic freedom principles or the right to publish results, especially where government funding is involved (IGER side, see EXHIBIT D), potentially conflicting with UK research laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Academic Freedom Principles, UK Research Regulations

perturbation.original_text: 13.3 EXCEPT AS PROVIDED IN ARTICLES 13.1 AND 13.2, THE PARTIES ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT NEITHER PARTY HAS MADE ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE HELD RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR LOSS OF PROFIT ARISING OUT OF THE USE OF ANY JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY, CERES INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY, IGER INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY, OTHER RESEARCH RESULTS OR BACKGROUND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY COVERED BY THIS AGREEMENT OR ANY SCHEDULE OR ARISING OUT OF THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN IF SUCH PARTY IS ADVISED IN ADVANCE OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.3 EXCEPT AS PROVIDED IN ARTICLES 13.1 AND 13.2, THE PARTIES ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT NEITHER PARTY HAS MADE ANY REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED. IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE HELD RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY SPECIAL, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OR LOSS OF PROFIT ARISING OUT OF THE USE OF ANY JOINT INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY, CERES INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY, IGER INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY, OTHER RESEARCH RESULTS OR BACKGROUND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY COVERED BY THIS AGREEMENT OR ANY SCHEDULE OR ARISING OUT OF THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN IF SUCH PARTY IS ADVISED IN ADVANCE OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE', the contract attempts to limit implied warranties. In most US states and the UK, disclaimers of implied warranties must be conspicuous and often use specific language. Removing this clause raises enforceability issues under the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) and similar UK sales laws, potentially creating unforeseen liability. This creates legal risks.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - US Law, Sale of Goods Act - UK Law
